intro: Solenanthus albanicus, commonly known as the Albanian solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and limestone soils, often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
